interestingFact: India has the world's largest postal network, with over 1.5 lakh post offices.
Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world's lakes combined.
Japan has a 'Crying Sumo' contest where wrestlers compete to see who can make a baby cry first.
Australia is home to the world's longest fence, built to keep kangaroos and emus away from crops.
Brazil is the only country to have appeared in every World Cup since the tournament began in 1930.
Egypt is home to the world's oldest pyramid, the Pyramid of Djoser, built around 2670 BC.
France was the first country to use the guillotine as a method of execution.
Italy is home to the world's first university, the University of Bologna, founded in 1088.
Mexico introduced chocolate, chilies, and corn to the world.
Russia has a larger surface area than Pluto.
